title: using const variable in generic implement causes rustc panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
using const variable in generic implement causes rustc panic, but using it in specialization like impl `A<u64>` and `A<u32>` without `A<T>` is fine;

I tried this code:
````
#[derive(Default)]
struct A<T> {
    t: T,
}

impl<T> A<T> {
    const LEN: usize = 4;

    fn p() {
        println!("{}", Self::LEN * 5); 
    }   
}
fn main() {
    A::<u64>::p();
    A::<u32>::p();
}
````

<code sample that causes the bug>
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: !impl_self_ty.has_infer_types()', librustc_mir/borrow_check/nll/type_check/mod.rs:1033:21                                                    
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.                                                                                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                          
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

I expected to see this happen: <explanation>
20
Instead, this happened: <explanation>
panic

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.31.0-nightly (f99911a4a 2018-10-23)
